citation.article-title: Paenibacillus sonchi sp. nov., a nitrogen-fixing species isolated from the rhizosphere of Sonchus oleraceus
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus sonchi sp. nov.

Paenibacillus sonchi (son′chi. L. n. sonchus -i, the herb sow-thistle, and also a botanical genus name; L. gen. n. sonchi of Sonchus, referring to the plant Sonchus oleraceus, the source of the rhizosphere soil from which the type strain was isolated).
Gram-positive, aerobic, motile, straight rods (0.5×5 μm).
Ellipsoidal spores are located centrally or subterminally in swollen sporangia.
Colonies on LD medium are circular, convex and glossy with entire margins after incubation for 72 h at 30 °C.
Temperature range for growth is 10–40 °C, with optimum growth at 30 °C.
Grows in the absence of NaCl and in 3 % (w/v) NaCl, but is unable to tolerate 5 % NaCl.
Growth is not inhibited by 0.001 % (w/v) lysozyme.
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Able to utilize fructose to produce acid, but not glucose, sucrose, lactose, succinate, d-xylose, maltose or l-aspartate.
The G+C content of the DNA of the type strain is 46.8 mol% (thermal denaturation method).
The type strain, X19-5T (=CCBAU 83901T=LMG 24727T), was isolated from rhizosphere soil of Sonchus oleraceus in Xinjiang, China.
